ygData.subject: Re: Question about pets
ygData.msgSnippet: It doesn t.  Skill affects ability to not fizzle, but level has no bearing (which sucks.)  When I got o Lavastorm I ll go through 2 to 8 bone chips trying to
ygData.messageBody:
It doesn't. Skill affects ability to not fizzle, but level has no
bearing (which sucks.) When I got o Lavastorm I'll go through 2 to 8 bone
chips trying to get a blue risky skeleton because all the green ones don't
help me at all. I wish it did have some effect, but sadly the higher up you
go the larger the "sucky" range of your skeleton.

Malark

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tony B [mailto:tonyb72@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 07, 1999 8:26 AM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Question about pets
>
>
> From: "Tony B" <tonyb72@...>
>
> i dont think it affects the strength of your pet (personally
> i think its
> random) but i think it does effect your chance of casting it.
> in general,
> ive found that the skills determine successful casting of
> spells, while your
> level effects the strength of the spell once cast.
>
> belphenor
> lodge of the dead
> neriak, fennin ro
>
>
> >From: Patrickje1@...
> >
> >Im currently a level 6 gnome necromancer on karana server
> and Ive got a
> >question about pets. Ive heard rumors that your conjuration
> skill directly
> >affects the level of the pet you summon. I was just
> wondering if there is
> >any
> >truth to this because Ive found that I summon from level 3-5
> and I usually
> >get each level the same number of times. Just wondering if
> conjuration is
> >higher will I summon those level 5 skeletons more often or
> if they can get
> >even more powerful.
> >
> >~Dracor
